Hi Noah,

My requirement is that if there are 10 links on one page, then I=
 want that those 10 links should be crawled in ascending(or descending, ran=
dom) order as they occur in the parent page.
How can this be possible? Is i=
t feasible to modify the UriPrecedencePolicy and other classes?
I am new to=
 this, so it will require a lot of time.

Regards,
Nikhil

> Hey,

> As I=
 mentioned previously, you can create a custom implementation of
> UriPrece=
dencePolicy to implement your desired crawl order. You can see how
> the pr=
ecedence value you generate is used in
> BdbMultipleWorkQueues.calculateIns=
ertKey(CrawlURI). Notably, the precedence
> value only accounts for one byt=
e of the insert key, so you're limited to
> 255 precedence levels. There is=
 room for finer customization, but that
> would involve custom implementati=
ons of other classes in addition to
> UriPrecedencePolicy.
> 
> But this
> =
might be more
>  advanced usage than you'
> re
>  comfortable with

cially if you didn't understand my previous emails.

hat you're trying to do, exactly. You say "crawl

ending, Descending or Random", but what are you

y by url??
